item.title: You should send some money to Haiti
item.dc:creator: DansonDelta40
item.description:
And Africa, the Middle East, South America, many Asian countries, the Philippines, Child Charity Organizations around the world, Rain Forest Protection Organizations, Wildlife Preservation Funds, etc.pp…

I forgot to mention the homeless people in your own country. They gotta be saved, too! And the money wouldn’t have such a long way to go, either.

Read full topic
item.source: You should send some money to Haiti

item.title: You should send some money to Haiti
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

right now, the United States is … well… for lack of a better word, Hated. Yes. Everyone thinks the U.S. is scum. No matter how much we give to other countries, we are slime. amirite?

The generally positive view that the rest of the world used to have of Americans was primarily because of our foreign aid and volunteers like the Peace Corps, and the huge amount of charitable donations that Americans make. It’s exactly things like sending money and search-and-rescue teams to Haiti that are going to rehabilitate our tarnished image.

That being said, I’m not exactly sure what sending “money” to Haiti is going to accomplish. They don’t have a functioning government, their infrastructure has been destroyed, and their only airport is already backed up with the logistics of giving humanitarian assistance to an entire country.

Read full topic

item.source: You should send some money to Haiti

item.title: You should send some money to Haiti
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
As a human race we are duty bound to help those in need.

But I remind everyone that right now, the United States is … well… for lack of a better word, Hated. Yes. Everyone thinks the U.S. is scum. No matter how much we give to other countries, we are slime. amirite? Personally, I am still very proud of my country and our people. Regardless of how broken or messed up we are. (starts to hum a patriotic song to herself)

That said, I am thinking there are many poor, starving and homeless within our own borders that need help as well. Personally, I think we should spend just as much time helping our own that we do helping other countries; of whom in the end will wind up biting our arses cuz we didnt do enough.

(Please PLEASE forgive my jaded thoughts. It is only that I have seen too much of this in history.)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
Hazzmat:

I don’t see them sending money to us if Europe got hit by a massive earthquake. Luckily we stand strong in our economic shoes so we can recover easily unlike all those poor and corrupt countries out there.

not necessarily haiti, but in times of the WWI and WWII latin america helped a lot of people whose countries had been hit by war.
